name: begetter
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
someone who creates something: He was a begetter of chamber music and concertos in the 1980s. He made no secret of the fact that he was the only begetter of The Bellingford Gazette, a local magazine produced four times a year.
More examplesFewer examplesSir Francis Galton, begetter of the eugenics movement, was a thoroughly nasty man in many ways.The begetters of the whole event are artist Chris Garratt and writer Mick Kidd.Directed by the only begetter of Driller Killer, this elliptical thriller is set at the interface of sleaze and glitz in Miami.
